review.itemreviewed: Lennox Lace Stkd WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
So far so good! 
I have sized up which is much better as they do seem to be small in general.
Very comfortable walking my dog on the beach.
Not tried them in the rain yet, but very happy so far.
review.name: Lovely looking boots

review.itemreviewed: Lennox Lace Stkd WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: So comfortable! Second pair of Sorrel to replace well worn older boots.  I sized up half a size.
review.name: Fantastic

review.itemreviewed: Lennox Lace Stkd WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Great  boot, bought (black) for an Alaska trip ( hiking , rain , puddles & lots of water )  wore 3 days straight for about 6 hours a day & my feet were happy.

My shoe size is 7 ½ I did size up due to prior reviews & I’m glad I did. Fit perfectly especially with wearing wool socks.
Just hard to get them on!
review.name: Great Boot - Once you get them on

review.itemreviewed: Lennox Lace Stkd WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I am normally a 7 but will need 7.5 if I am going to consider keeping these. The sole is very comfy even though the heel isn’t entirely spongy -but better than most cheaper boots that are rock hard. Very sturdy - but then a bit too stiff! Even though I love the design and colour of the shoe, these are very difficult to put on and seem very stiff around the leg. I have really narrow feet and legs so I can imagine if your feet are wider and chunky it would be really hard to put them on, even though once they are on there is plenty of room! I’m sure you can put up with it but I think it would annoy me after a while. I understand that you can break into boots gradually but I bought timberland boots a year ago and I thought I could break into them but gave up for similar reasons like the puffy ankle bit at the top of the shoe feeling restrictive round my leg! Although the padding around the top of the rim at the back of the shoe LOOKS comfy, I personally find it uncomfortable because it doesn’t align with my leg and the rest of my ankle properly. I think the tallest part of the shoe needs to be angled back slightly to allow for more flexibility like some of the other boots I own. Perhaps if you have larger ankles you can fill out the shoe more in the right places. So best to just try them out for yourself!
review.name: Lovely colour and design , not as comfy as hoped!

review.itemreviewed: Lennox Lace Stkd WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Wish I would have sized up half size, runs a bit small, love the color
review.name: Great boot

review.itemreviewed: Lennox Lace Stkd WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
So comfortable.
I ordered a size dependent on the actual measurement of my foot which was bigger than my normal shoe size. It fits perfectly.
review.name: Awesome boot!

review.itemreviewed: Lennox Lace Stkd WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Dear Sorel - please do NOT keep this boot a secret. They are absolutely the most comfortable boot I have ever worn.  My daughter has had a pair for a few years and raves about them, so I ordered a pair for myself.  Literally I doubt I will wear any other shoe for months, I Love these so much. They hug your foot like nothing I have ever experienced.   They are adorable and can be worn with just about anything.   I bought them up a size so I could wear socks with them and they are completely perfect.  Love Love Love these boots!!!! Thank you Sorel!
review.name: The MOST AMAZING BOOT EVER

review.itemreviewed: Lennox Lace Stkd WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I sized half size down. They are perfect, very comfortable. Love the look of them!
review.name: Great boots! Stylish and comfortable. Couldn’t be happier. Sorel’s are definitely quality.

review.itemreviewed: Lennox Lace Stkd WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: IN LOVE!!! They fit true to size and the soles aren't heavy. Feels like I'm walking on clouds. These are the perfect stylish white boots. They can be dressed up or down for your favorite seasonal looks. I'm already scoping out another color because they're too comfy not to have another pair!
review.name: Walking on Clouds

name: Lennox Lace Stkd WP Boot - Women's

description: Buy the Osprey Packs Tempest Velocity 20L Backpack - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Tempest Velocity 20L Backpack - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Osprey Packs Tempest Velocity 20L Backpack - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Broke this backpack in on a 17.5 mile hike up Half Dome in Yosemite. 

Pros:
- Comfortable. I'm 5'2" and purchased the XS/S. Had no issues with fit or straps digging in anywhere through the 11 hour hike. All straps are adjustable. 
- Vest straps are awesome. I stuffed my Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra in one of the front pockets. Secure fit. Having my phone in an easily accessible place was the selling point for me. I typically stick my phone in a phone pouch strapped to the chest straps of my other hiking bags and usually nervous about the phone pouch flinging off. 
- Fits a lot of stuff: had two 1.5L bladders, two sandwiches, a day's worth of snacks, rain cover, jacket, wipes/day-hike toiletries, headlamp, Nalgene bottle, trash bag, battery pack, gloves, and was 50% full. 
- One of the pouches on the waist strap has an easy access/unzippered pouch. This was awesome for trash-on-the-go. I stuffed my remnants of energy gel packets here. 

Cons:
- There are no compartments in the body of the bag. It's one big roomy compartment in the back and a small stash compartment in the front. 
- The cinch closure top is kind of annoying and I would've preferred a zippered closure as I find those easier to handle when my hands are tired/swollen/cold.
review.name: Comfortable and roomy but no compartments

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Have used it only once on a 5 hour hike to summit Quandary. Comfortable enough and finally, an accessible pocket for your phone. My Osprey reservoir doesn't fit as well as in my old backpack.
review.name: Have used it only once

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this bag! I had originally been loyal to Dakine but after reading reviews of the suspension system used in Osprey I decided to give it a try. I absolutely love this bag! It's comfortable, practical and bonus, those colors are awesome!
review.name: I love this bag! I

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was looking for 20L pack my 30L is a bit too big for non technical day hikes. I took it out for few hikes and am loving it! Super lightweight, good fit to the body, the side and back mesh pockets makes it more roomy than 20L. Pockets on shoulder straps are convenient. I don’t have a small bottle to fit in there but use it for my phone, sunscreen and energy bars. Hip belt also has pockets and good for small things. Yet to see the durability side but the functionality of the bag is really awesome and I highly recommend it.
review.name: I was looking for 20L

review.reviewBody: This pack strikes the perfect balance of fastpack pocket accessibility and hip belt support. I just got this pack so have only taken it on a couple trail test runs, but so far I love it! Very comfortable and easy to access my snacks, fluids and phone for pictures while on the move. There is also ample storage space while being compact enough on my back not to weigh me down. The pack design is 5 stars. I took off 1 star because I wish there were more colors options. Having pink and gray be the only women options is a bummer. A blue/ aqua or yellow option would be awesome. Or at least make the straps interchangeable to allow for like customization of color there. I like flare on the trail! :)
review.name: Great pack- need more bright colors

name: Tempest Velocity 20L Backpack - Women's

review.reviewBody: I got a great deal on two new XTR brake rotors from Backcountry. The first set were fantastic and lasted 3years, but I made the mistake of letting my pads wear out and the rotors ended up close to the wear limit. After a proper break-in, my new pads and rotors are quiet and have plenty of stopping power.  Check those brakes regularly and look for Backcountry to give you a great deal on replacement parts.
review.name: New XTR Brake Rotors

review.reviewBody:
These rotors are so good I was thinking about getting the XTs for a lesser price but decided to go  with these and I made the right decision. The cooling fins work so well. Before these I had non fin rotors and after only a few laps at the park I could cook and egg on them. Now with these it takes more than double the runs to get them even close to that hot. And even if they are hot they still maintain the same braking power the whole time. Would totally recommend to anyone who is having overheating problems or 
squeaky-brakeidis.
review.name: Life Changing Brake

review.reviewBody:
Wow. I was running the 9100 160mm front/back rotors and once they get hot they warp and grind until the cool down. It was so unbelievably embarrassing. 

I switched to XTR and now it is a non issue. I suspect Shimano is done with the 9100 rotors and all the pros are on XTR for a reason (not just minor weight decrease).
review.name: Much better than 9100
comment: what brake pads are you using with them? I need to replace the 9100, i have same issue with warping and making loud noise!

review.reviewBody:
Like previous reviewers, I went with the XTR rotor on the road bike to upgrade my Ultegra rotors. The XTR rotors are around 20g lighter (rotational mass!) and look sooo much better.

There's a reason why so many World Tour Teams opted for these rotors in the 2020 Tour de France ... I also suspect these handle cross winds better, as they have more ventilation and won't catch the wind as much.

No brainer upgrade for the aesthetic and weight-conscious cyclist. Road, Gravel, MTB, etc. 

Brag to your friends about saving some GRAMS on that next group ride. You know you will.
review.name: Killer upgrade

review.reviewBody: I have been running ice rotors since they came out, and never had anything but good things to say about them. I always run XT, but I found the new version with the fins way too shiny for my taste, so I had to bite the bullet and upgrade to XTR, which are about $30 extra, for few grams lighter BUT black fins - I know, but I have to keep the ride looking good :-). Anyway outside of that, those are solid rotors, and I am sure they run bit cooler then the older version, but not noticeable to me. For some reason I like the old design better, cleaner look, but I am sure the black XTR  will grow on me - the shiny XT has no chance though.
review.name: Great rotors but bit pricey.

name: XTR/Dura-Ace Centerlock Disc Rotor

review.itemreviewed: Intraknit Thermal Merino Crew Baselayer - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love this top. It keeps me warm and I like the look just as a shirt. It’s slim fitting so it comfortably fits under other layers. However, for some reason it snags constantly on things so I’m concerned about its longevity. Otherwise, I love it
review.name: Love it, but snags

review.itemreviewed: Intraknit Thermal Merino Crew Baselayer - Women's
review.reviewBody: This top is my new favorite base layer.  It is super soft, moves with you and warm!!  I have many wool base layers which worked fine and made hold off on buying yet another one but I am so happy I did!  Buying one more as I keep wanting to wear it over the others.  I live in the PNW and spend a decent amount of time outside and find that high performance clothing items like this make it so much more enjoyable.
review.name: I love this top

review.itemreviewed: Intraknit Thermal Merino Crew Baselayer - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought this for my mom and daughter and it kept them warm in Aspen. And aspen is cold! It does run a little small and it?s snug.  If you?re in between sizes or just want not such a tight fit I?d definitely go up one size. It?ll still fit you right.
review.name: It keeps you warm

review.itemreviewed: Intraknit Thermal Merino Crew Baselayer - Women's
review.reviewBody: Such a cute design and cut! It?s darling and capable! It does fit a touch more snuggly than my other smart wool, so if you?re on the fence between sizes maybe size up. The sleeves and body are nice and long. For reference I?m 5?10? and 125 pounds and I got a small, which was pretty skin tight, a medium might have been a better fit for me. Unfortunately I did end up returning this because it snagged a little too easily. At full price it wasn?t worth it but if I see it on discount somewhere, I?ll pick another one up ? it?s that cute even though it?s a little fragile!
review.name: Cute and snug but a little fragile

review.itemreviewed: Intraknit Thermal Merino Crew Baselayer - Women's
review.reviewBody:
if you're thinking about buying this , go three sizes up. 

I purchased this sweater online. Typically I wear small, and wanted a little looser, so chose a medium. This sweater is so tight I can barely get it on, it's like a xxs. Customer service won't cover the return shopping, even though there is absolutely no way a person could know to "choose up 1-2 sizes" (as they've told me during my issues trying to get the return covered.) BUYER BEWARE.  Fits like kids clothing
review.name: fits ridiculously small

review.itemreviewed: Intraknit Thermal Merino Crew Baselayer - Women's
review.reviewBody: I like this fit more than many other styles of Smart Wool because it was more fitted than many of the unshapely looser styles. I got the Marlin for some color, and it?s a deep enough  color to not be too bright.  I have a long torso and this shirt is plenty long, so it may be too long for shorter gals.
review.name: Flattering fit!

review.reviewBody: Fit is great, material is quiet and feels nice, sheds water very well. Although the men's zipper is "backwards" from the standard, it didn't take long at all to get used to. The hood will definitely fit a bicycle or climbing helmet and is easily adjustable.
review.name: Nice job RAB!

review.reviewBody: This jacket feels good with it's stretch. The blue is also really nice and the fit is great for a long armed person.   I wish it had pit zips but the deal breaker is the zipper!!!  What a terrible device to put on a good jacket.  It's got a tiny two-way zippy bit to thread into and big teeth.  I found it terrible to start and it does not get better as I zip it up.  I don't have that kind of patience.  I am fan of Rab which has batted 100% until now.  As much as I need a rain coat and liked this one, I am not willing to fight a zipper like this.
review.name: Great color!

name: Kinetic Alpine 2.0 Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: These boots are awesome !!! Comfy and fit great, another well done from Ariat
review.name: Rambler

review.reviewBody: All the thick calved ladies! These boots are just what I hoped for. They are comfortable and look great. I wear them all day and don’t have any rubbing or sore feet. They run true to my normal shoe size. I couldn’t be happier!! Tempted to buy another pair to keep back.
review.name: Comfortable on my thick stubby legs!

review.reviewBody: These boots look the best and feel the best out of all the boots I own. My boots are about 5 years old and still look new.
review.name: Best boots I own

review.reviewBody: First pair of boots I ever bought, wore them for years.
Great fit, great style have a pair for working in the orchard and a pair for line dancing. Overall great product!
comment: Thank you for your feedback on this boot.  We so appreciate you taking the time to leave a review.  Please contact info@ariat.com or give us a call at 1-877-702-7428  if you need further assistance in this matter.

review.reviewBody: These are the best boots I own. They are super comfy and fit my feet great. I can wear these all day long as my wife drags me around from store to store. These boots are also comfortable to wear as I work outside in thick brush. These are my first pair of boots and I haven’t had any issues adjusting to wearing them. They hold up to getting wet but will eventually start to show water spots so make sure you get a good leather protective.
review.name: BEST boots I own!!!!!

review.reviewBody: Rambler boots have been super comfortable and easily used in any occasion. Size has been fairly accurate and it does have a wide option, which has been great.
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Just bought these and we got a snow/ice storm. I’ve been wearing them with everything and everywhere! Love them. So comfy and cute!
review.name: So comfy, I wear them with everything!

review.reviewBody: These fit beautiful on the foot but sadly for me the top was too lose for my thinner legs. However my housemate saw me trying them and her eyes went wild when she saw them and she tried them and they fit beautifully on her legs so she swiped them straight from me.  I think if these were made in two sizes to fit different leg widths it would be best as for me my legs looked lost in the amount of space around the rim. It would need tapering in for me.  I would have kept and worn them though regardless but someone else fell in love   The quality of these boots is top notch and they are honestly the most gorgeous boots I have ever seen. I will be jealous to watch my friend wear them and they feel like heaven on the foot…so soft and comfy and the fit on the foot was perfect.
review.name: Gorgeous

review.reviewBody: At first it felt odd that the top part was thin soft leather, unlike the stiffer boots; but I soon began to love the feel of free ankle movement, and ultimate comfort of this boot. I also love the fact that the outsole does not collect mud and organic barn debris...cleans off so easy with the boot brush or just a good door mat!
review.name: Nice comfy boot

name: Rambler Western Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: Finally, a Patagonia fleece without the very annoying elastic at the bottom. Soft and light weight and surprisingly warm.  Appreciate the 1/2 zip over a 1/4 zip.  Love the color blocking. Got both the mixed orange rust one and the gold/brown one. Looks stylish not nerdy.  At 5’4” and 112 lbs and a 33” bust 37” hip, the XS fit well in width, and also arm length. I hope they continue this product and offer fun new colors next year, I’ll be an ongoing fan of this one!
review.name: Comfortable fleece, hip friendly

review.reviewBody: Comfortable. Warm. Fits good. A little lighter than I was expecting. Wish it had an arm zip pocket but otherwise I really like it and am happy with my purchase
review.name: Good fit.

review.reviewBody: One of my partner's favorite layering pieces when she goes hiking outdoors. It's soft material keeps her warm but without feeling bulky.
review.name: Super warm and comfortable

review.reviewBody: Very pleased with this. Get up To An Extra 20% OFF discount from: promo1024.com
review.name: Brilliant!

review.reviewBody:
The jacket was too boxy and did not fit well. 
Also, the delivery was placed by my garage and not the front door, for all to see I received a package.
review.name: Top too boxy

review.reviewBody: This fleece is great for the spring and fall as well as chilly summer nights.  I have many Patagonia fleece  pullovers and this one is my go to for shoulder seasons.  It is not too heavy but offers warmth.  It is a nice cropped style that looks good with anything. I am 5'7" 145 lbs.  and the medium fits perfectly.  I liked it so much I ordered another color and the sale price was great.
review.name: Spring and Fall Fleece

review.reviewBody: This fleece is cropped and a perfect length, not too short. It’s soft and a nice in-between weight, not too heavy and not too light. The blue/green color is really sharp.
review.name: Great fleece

review.reviewBody: It’s the perfect cropped fleece (but not too short). Fits slightly oversized and looks good with EVERYTHING! I bought it in 2 colors and live in them. Heck yea Patagonia!
review.name: Fav pullover fleece

name: Microdini Half-Zip Fleece - Women's

review.reviewBody: It runs a little big so be wary of that.  I'm 6'2", 210, dad bod, not yoked and I got a large though I'm usually an XL..  It's super warm and super soft and everything i had hoped it would be.
review.name: Love this sweater!

review.reviewBody:
I was stoked to upgrade from my wannabe thrift store sweater to the authentic version donned by The Dude but the fit was poor and at this price point. 

The large fit like an oversized potato sack so I tried Medium which was much closer to working but still felt relatively short, and looks somewhat stretched and hung unevenly at the waistline. Perhaps they were aiming to make it fit like a worn 25 year old vintage sweater despite being new?

Bummed as I always wanted to score the OG version!

description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Roamer Double Sleeping Pad online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Roamer Double Sleeping Pad
hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Roamer Double Sleeping Pad online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: We love this Roamer double for short family canoe trips where weight and space are not the biggest priority. It's comfortable and warm, and relatively easy to blow up. It's not going to blow-up as fast or deflate as fast as a smaller mat, but that's kind of what you expect. The thickness of the materials used in the pad make it heavier, but also more durable. I think this mat will last for many years and family canoe trips to come.
review.name: High quality double mattress for canoe camping

review.reviewBody: We just love this air mattress! Great nights sleep. No aches when waking up!!
review.name: Roamer Double Mattress

review.reviewBody: From a very picky sleeper, this pad is as good as a top-quality mattress.  It doesn't feel like it a an air mattress, thanks to the cellular structure. It took a while to self-inflate the first time out of the bag. I eventually pumped in some air. It works great now. Very easy to stow away, and very light.
review.name: Very comfortable

review.reviewBody: This mattress is more comfortable than the mattress I use for a bed, and can be inflated or deflated to customize the comfort for different body types. Soft and strong, it's the second one I'm buying, as my son "borrowed" the first one for an indefinite period. If you have cats, do not let them scratch the mattress. Otherwise it is very sturdy.
review.name: Comfortable and long-lasting

review.reviewBody: We are a bunch or glampers trying to ease into roughing it and this mattress makes it easy. Super comfortable,  fits my 3 person tent perfectly and is super easy to inflate/deflate.
review.name: Comfort on the go

review.reviewBody: This mattress is so comfortable.  The use of foam in the interior makes it so much more comfortable than traditional air only sleeping pads (also it makes it much warmer).  Packing and unpacking is super easy.  I like how Nemo has separate valves for each function — this makes each task super easy.
review.name: Life changing comfort

review.reviewBody: Perfect Mattress!  It is easy to inflate and is the most comfortable mattress I have ever used.
review.name: Perfect Mattress

review.reviewBody: Good quality and super comfortable. I can't wait to use this on my next trip!
review.name: Comfy sleeping pad

review.reviewBody: Very very comfortable but very tight fitting into Jazz double sleeping bag, seems to be a bit large for the bag which is a bit of a bummer.  self inflating didn't seem to work in -30deg F weather either. Inflation had to be done with provided pump sack, which works really well. Ultimately, still happy with the pad but let down by the issues.
review.name: Good but not great

review.reviewBody: Best purchase! The double roamer is a big purchase and I have No REGRET! After the first night camping my partner rolled over and said it felt like sleeping at home. It really is 4 inches of comfort! Open the valves, walk away for 30 minutes and it's over 50% inflated. Took it winter camping and we were never cold.10 out of 10!
review.name: Felt like sleeping at Home

name: Roamer Double Sleeping Pad

review.itemreviewed: Line Logo Ridge Pocket Responsibili-T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody:
This was actually the first Patagonia product I ever bought, and I had no idea what to expect on purchase. After months of wearing it and keeping it in the top of my drawer -- I actually own 4 more!

The responsibili-T cotton is so soft, and it feels great to wear; it's got a very sturdy and comforting feel, without feeling bulky or overly heavy. It's such a unique-feeling material, and it keeps me warm on cool days, without making me sweat on hot ones. The shirts look great on their own and pair well with everything. 

It does run a little big, but I think the slightly boxy / relaxed fit works well on most guys (I bought these in size M, since that's what I normally buy from other brands, but you can tell it has a relaxed fit on me). If you're on the cusp of two sizes (I'm between an S and and M), I would recommend sizing down for a more "traditional" fit, and sizing up for a "boxy" fit. Regardless, the shoulders and top of chest fit well regardless of size, so it's mostly down to the torso!

You can't go wrong either way, honestly.
review.name: My first foray into Patagonia, love it

review.itemreviewed: Line Logo Ridge Pocket Responsibili-T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: Loving this shirt as everything other by patagonia!
review.name: Nice!

review.itemreviewed: Line Logo Ridge Pocket Responsibili-T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: I absolutely love this shirt. The cotton blend (50% cotton 50% polyester) provides a great feel with the sweat wicking of polyester. Additionally you can use this shirt for hiking but also wear it for a dressier casual outfit.
review.name: Versatile shirt

review.itemreviewed: Line Logo Ridge Pocket Responsibili-T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: I ordered a large, and it's closer to a 3XL. The quality is great, but it's pretty absurdly large. I own many other Patagonia shirts and the sizing on this one is bizarre.
review.name: Ridiculous sizing

review.itemreviewed: Line Logo Ridge Pocket Responsibili-T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: Bought this for son in law, he said it was comfortable and great design but slightly runs large compared to other Patagonia shirts.
review.name: Love it

name: Line Logo Ridge Pocket Responsibili-T-Shirt - Men's

hasVariant.name: Subterra Carry-On 40L Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Subterra Carry-On 40L Bag online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Subterra Carry-On 40L Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Subterra Carry-On 40L Bag online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought this bag for a two week trip to Italy.  I loved it and found it to be the perfect size for all my items…including a CPAP machine.  When we returned home from our trip, my wife went and bought one for our next trip.
review.name: Great for travelling up to two weeks

review.reviewBody:
I bought this following a trip to Europe with a wheeled carryon, as I was frustrated with how much more mobile my travel companion was carrying just a backpack.  
This is ideal for a single person for a week or so, or a couple for a weekend.  
Very roomy.   Used it for a subsequent trip and was able to fit all my stuff for a week at the beach, plus some of our kids stuff.  As a carryon, I just used the included laptop bag and it was big enough for a laptop, tablet, kindle, and Nintendo switch, plus a large book, plus some snacks.  
I echo previous comments - a bit awkward accessing the main pouch with the backpack straps attached, but not an issue for the type of travelling I usually do. Also note that there isn’t a water bottle attachment, but a carabiner holds my Nalgene on no problem.  
Overall very happy with the purchase.  We already have a Thule Subterra suitcase (the large one that zips apart to become two bags) and this suitcase is just as functional.  
Great job Thule.
review.name: Well made and sturdy

review.reviewBody: The slick and simple, yet full of pockets, design allows this backpack to even fit under the seat when overhead compartments are full. The smart design of the computer+documents bag pocket allows you to easily access it when going through security and before you get into your seat. Another feature I really appreciate is the opening of the backpack as you would open a regular suitcase allowing access to all of your items. Overall a great backpack with high quality materials and construction. I tend to pack a lot of things and this backpack is able to last under that pressure
review.name: Best traveling backpack I've ver had

review.reviewBody: Great bag but the shell could be harder. I really prefer the carry-on 4 wheels with compression plate. It was smaller a little bit but hold stuff much better according to the harder shell and compression plate. A little bit disappointed.
review.name: Great but the shell could be harder.

review.reviewBody: The perfectly sized bag for short trips or carry-on bag. Well constructed, quality materials. Plenty of space and convenient pockets for easy access. The separate laptop sleeve is great as a stand alone laptop/office bag, or separate for additional items. This is my new go-to weekend/over night bag.
review.name: Thule Subterra

review.reviewBody: I don't have any cons of the bag so far. I have been using this bag for 2 years or so. i have flown, gone backpacking and road trips with this bag. it holds SO much! it is definitely capable of taking you on any short adventure. I have been able to pack 4-6 days in this bag several times. The outside is durable and these zippers will take a beating.
review.name: My go-to travel bag

review.reviewBody: I had a lot of backpacks, bags and this one is the best. Lot of place and you can use different kinds of straps
review.name: Best bag ever

review.reviewBody: Bought it a month ago, felt in love with the product!
review.name: Really good quality

review.reviewBody: I’ve had this bag about 4 years now. I adore it and have done 10-day trips (with 1 load of laundry at day 6). Extremely well-thought out - love the laptop sleeve and pocket in particular. I put the shoulder strap on laptop sleeve to head to meetings at my destination. However, once your laptop is added, the bag is so heavy that carrying any distance as tote or backpack is not very feasible. I ended up buying a little luggage cart when I had a (bag-unrelated injury) in Chicago and carrying it went from infeasible to impossible. So far no one has objected to it as carry on with bag and wheels. If you’re up for a luggage cart , it’s an excellent travel bag.
review.name: Love it but needed to purchase cart

review.reviewBody:
Lightweight, functional, many pockets, laptop sit nicely inside. It’s a bit too big. Because I am a short person.
Simple look. Just love it.
review.name: Very useful piece

name: Subterra Carry-On 40L Bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very comfortable! This pillow upped my sleep factor. It’s light and compact, perfect for backpacking and travel. So worth the money!

review.reviewBody: I love the look, and the material is very soft. Size up if you want to wear a t-shirt underneath. The material has started to show wear/pill after several wearings. I haven't even washed it yet and it looks very worn. I wear it as a layer under my jacket, so maybe the jacket is causing rubs (but I haven't had this issue with other clothing). I'm glad that I got it on sale.

review.reviewBody: Love these! I have one in almost every color. Great on the trail on crisp days when you don’t want a jacket. Great to explore in town too
review.name: Love these!

review.reviewBody: Love this shirt. So good looking, comfortable and warm. I just ordered another one!

review.reviewBody: Good quality, fit as expected. I bought for myself, but ended up giving to my daughter, who loved it too.

review.reviewBody: This is a very warm, light sweatshirt in wonderful colours. The cut and collar is superb. If it had a pocket or two it would be perfect. Would like to also see more natural fabrics in the products.

review.reviewBody: These are my favorite layer pieces. So warm and comfortable, fit nicely.

review.name: Comfy sweater

review.reviewBody:
are useless.

The unzippered leg cuff is so tight that I cannot add warmers or pads without taking the pants off.. and I cannot take the pants off without taking my shoes off.. I have tried with 510s and Specialized 2FO DH shoes

If I could easily remove the pants with shoes on, this would be a 5 star product, and probably the best on the market. The material & stretch is great, I love the pockets and the vents are awesome.
review.name: Almost perfect, but the ankle zips...

review.reviewBody:
I gave the Slickrock pants a four star rating mainly because I have nothing else to compare it with.  I am older, and in better than average condition for the age.  My main sport, is running my very fast dogs in agility.  Bicycling helps keep me in condition for those 30 second competition dog runs.  

I got the pants in early fall and have made maybe 6 rides in the 10 + mile range.  I do only road cycling. With the weather holding warm until Thanksgiving, feel very comfortable with temperatures over 45*F.  This morning was the first hard frost opportunity to ride.  I backed up the Slickrocks with synthetic long johns, and set out.  The legs felt a tad cool.  The sudden drop in temperature probably played a role in that.  I am still adjusting my gear to support cold weather bicycling.  This mornings ride was only a couple of miles to test where I am.  Definitely need better riding gloves!  

Back to the pants, I am short.  Wish the Slickrocks came in a 30" length, but putting one fold in the pant legs took care of the excess material.  Otherwise great pants!

5'7", weight 165. Male
review.name: First bicycle pants!

review.reviewBody: The style, color and fabric are pretty much what I was hoping for.  But - the leg cuff zippers are on the inside of the leg, not the outside.  The zipper literally gets caught in the front crank/chain, not just a few times. Not only is the leg full of oil, it has proven dangerous!  I ordered a medium which fits but a tad tight in the waist (5’20” @180 pounds…. Sometimes 175). I have not washed them yet, but appears to be made well and should hold up.
review.name: Almost fits the bill, but the cuffs?

review.reviewBody: Love them but almost returned because there’s only 2 pockets. Not great for travel but great for biking and bumming around.
review.name: Fit is awesome! Needs more pockets.

review.reviewBody:
I was looking for some casual and functional pants. I always wear shorts and hate pants. The material is actually quite breathable. I would normally never wear pants biking or hiking however these are the pants to wear. 

The access on the sides if you need to make any adjustments for knee pads or just leave the sides open for extra venttialtion came in handy when I was out hiking in the desert. I highly recommend these. I am about to buy my third pair.

This should go without saying but the material is easy to burn so if you are wearing these around a campfire make sure to keep some distance. I did burn a very small whole the first day of testing. Other than that they are rock solid.
review.name: Better than imagined

review.reviewBody: Love these pants so far. Easy to get on and off, true to size and comfortable. Too new to speak to durability.
review.name: Great fit!

review.reviewBody: Purchased this pants in chipmunk color and while I like the style and feel. The fabric attract dirt and grime and even after taking extra steps on those stains. For this is not a pants that match the reality of MTB.
review.name: A spot magnet

review.reviewBody: I bought these this fall after wearing the shorts for most of the summer. With cycling shorts and light merino long underwear, I have perfected my lower body winter fat bike clothing set up.
review.name: My go to winter cycling pants.

review.reviewBody: These pants are great! Super comfortable, the fabric is amazing and balances ventilation with warmth while cycling. Pockets run a bit small but keep everything tucked away and don’t allow movement, which is really nice while biking. The fit around the calves is snug, a bit loose around the knees, and then keeps its fitted cut around the waist. These will be my go to pants for biking, hiking, and maybe even around town!
review.name: Super comfortable

review.reviewBody:
It fits well and is comfortable, until you start moving. It breathes very poorly and the side vents are insufficient to let the heat out. 
When biking, the seat of the pants has no grip and they’re sliding all over. 
Also the pockets are awkward, phone or wallet always stick out and slide around uncomfortably. 
Only good part: the fabric seems fairly robust when crashing.
review.name: Really wanted to like those pants …

review.reviewBody: I bought this as my first backpacking tent, and although we've had some good (but heavy) times, it is not worth the money. I have used this tent multiple times in the wind and it has failed every time. I even added additional guy lines. The fly on the non-door side is too small to let wind appropriately come up under or over it. The poles don't maintain their X structure well and slide/flatten into one another in the wind. Basically, if it's windy, expect the side wall to literally lay on your body.
review.name: 1P Regrets

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] While a little on the heavy side, this is a great tent to start backpacking with. I've taken it out a few times now and it has worked out great. The tent is very roomy, I had space ar my head and feet to store gear amd the vestibule had plany of room for my pack. This is a solid tent.
review.name: Tungsten 1P

review.reviewBody: The material used for the floor and footprint feels quite cheap and slippery compared to similar priced tents, like Big Anges. I laid down inside in this tent in the backyard and closed the zipper door to get a feel for the amount of space inside: I started to feel claustrophobic. Not sure if this will happen in another one person tent or I need a bigger tent. If I kept the tent I don’t feel it would last a few years given the material used. Disappointed.
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody: I needed a lighter weight, solo or summer as most of my dear is three season and winter. While there are lighter options out there, this 10 is perfect for me.
review.name: Great addition to my gear closet.

review.reviewBody: Tent seems well made but is definitely too heavy for what it is - probably because it's made from polyester instead of nylon. It is also very flimsy so probably will be a terror in wind especially if you can't manage to reach under the fly to attach the Velcro straps to the poles.
review.name: Overly heavy
comment:
Thank you for providing us with feedback on our product. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention.

We are very sorry to hear that the item has not met your expectations.

At Marmot, we strive for excellence and we set a high standard for ourselves, and we are so sorry to hear this was not met in your interaction with our brand. We greatly value our consumers' insights, which are collected and shared with our product development teams for consideration. We appreciate your effort and do hope that you will reconsider using Marmot products in the future.

We are happy to assist in resolving any issues you may experience with our products.

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST

Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: I bought this tent to trek Torres del Paine the O circuit. I experienced many different climates and there were nights that the wind was just unbearable. However, the tent held on strong, it was semi light weight and extremely easy for one person to put up even with the windy weather. It was affordable and I am so happy I chose this tent for my trek. Highly reccomend.
review.name: Great tent!

review.reviewBody:
The most extreme occasion that ive used this tent so far was when i camped by a lake where temp got down to 16F at night. I left the vent at the roof open and also left the top zipper in the rain fly (the zipper next to the door zipper) half open. In the morning the outer side of the tent was entirely covered with frost but i didn't have any frost or ice on the inner mesh. I accidentally had left my backpack in the vestibule in a way that only half of it was actually in the vestibule and that half was covered with frost but the other half did not have any frost on it. 
The only thing that i do not like about this tent is that foot print does not stay attached to the poles or the tent once the tent is fully set up. The reason is that the size of the foot print is slightly bigger than the size of the tent. If u wanna move ur tent once uve set it up (before uve staked it) the foot print flys off.
review.name: Im very pleased with this tent

review.reviewBody:
I own quite few tents from many brands, including Marmot, but have been looking for a small, freestanding 1 person tent/bivy shelter for use in the shoulder season in tight spots near treeline. There are many options out there but they are usually ultralight manufacturers and are very expensive and made with thin, delicate fabrics.

The Tungsten 1P is a pretty solid overall model and I was pleased to fit in it with some space. (I am 6 ft 3 in tall). It is the usual solid contructionI expect from Marmot but had several disappointing features about it. First and foremost is the weight. It is advertised at 3 lbs 9 oz but my official measurements had it comfortably over 4 lbs with everything it came with. Even ditching the footprint that is really heavy for a 1 person freestanding tent. I have many 2 person tents in this weight range. Second issue was the amount of mesh. I specifically chose this model over the ultralight version because I'm using for shoulder season and wanted less mesh. The pictures so a nice high fabric front on the door/vestibule side, perfect for what I wanted, but the back wall opposite the door is all mesh down to the bathtub floor. Considering how heavy it already is I'm sure that is why this was chosen but it was not what I was expecting. The third issue I found was that the fabrics of the body and fly are quite baggy and sag unless you have a really taut pitch, which can be an issue depending on the type of ground you pitch it on. I think this will be particularly problematic on the all mesh back wall. The fly rests right on it and I suspect will let moisture through. This could have been alleviated or prevented with a short cross pole at the top, which adds some tension and better headroom. This is becoming a common feature on most new 1 person tents but is lacking in Marmot models.

So all in all a well made tent and a good value but some of the design choices are disappointing and the weight could be an issue for many people. If weight is an issue and you'll be using the tent in warmer weather the ultralight version seems to be worth the extra money.
review.name: Fairly Ordinary Tent But A Good Value
comment:
Hello there

Thank you for providing us with a feedback on our products. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention. I am very sorry to hear that the item has not met your expectations. We will make sure to forward your idea and feedback to an appropriate department, so that we may think about an appropriate solution for the future. Thank you so much for sharing your opinion with us.

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via Contact Us | Marmot or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST

Thank You.
Marmot Team.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] So far, so good. On my first trip out with the Tungsten 1 person tent, it rained pretty heavily in the middle of the night and not a drop of water inside. It is a super small tent, but that's to be expected for such a light backpacking option.

review.reviewBody: Great company to deal with. Fast shipping, excellent quality of materials. Would deal with them again. Most of all my wife loved the hoody.
review.name: A great place to deal with

review.reviewBody: Per usual~ fantastic fit, ridiculously comfortable, great colors and premium quality!! Can’t go wrong with SIMM’s :)
review.name: If Loving SIMM’s Is Wrong, I Don’t Want To Be Right

review.reviewBody: Comfy. Well crafted. Love the finger loop and thumb hole. Would buy again! Felt confident swimming in it in South America - no sunburn!
review.name: Great product!

review.reviewBody: Fit and cut is amazing ! True to size. Bought for team for fishing tournament and everyone loves them !
review.name: Great !

review.reviewBody: I love these shirts! I have almost every color. Great fabric and fit. I love the hood - perfectly sized to fit over my long braided hair and hat - and STAYS UP! The button at the neck is a really nice feature.  The thumb holes are also great!
review.name: Perfect Fishing Shirt

review.reviewBody: Nice feel and construction. Good hood—fits over a ball cap with plenty of fabric to stay up and provide shade, but not so much it’s baggy. Nice snap at the neck to adjust sun protection vs ventilation. Simms, I’d love a second snap to close the neck even more on occasion, but that’s a pretty minor thing. I’m usually a medium, 5’7”/142 lbs/36b; I sized up to a large in this after trying on both because I wanted it a little loose rather than a little snug so it’s cooler, and slightly longer arms.  Both sizes were close, so go with your personal preference if you’re around my size.
review.name: Great sun hoody, consider sizing up

review.reviewBody: Cozy, great fit, light weight, and great sun protection
review.name: Cozy, great fit, light weight, and great sun protection

review.reviewBody:
Been wearing men’s solar flex shirts for years and last year I bought my first women’s. I was VERY impressed. As someone who spends as much time on the water as I do, these shirts not only keep me comfortable, but provide the cooling aspect we sometimes desperately need! Paired with the new joggers, this outfit is a hands down must for every female angler. 

For size reference: I’m 5’8 145lbs and I typically wear a medium. Sometimes if I want a tighter fit, I’ll get a small.
review.name: #1 stable for summer fishing!

review.reviewBody:
I have many of your Men’s Solarflex hoodies. I wear them working as Horticulturist, in the field, and while padding in the ADKS. They’re great! 

So, I bought one for my wife…she told me this…Her Solarflex hoodie completed her paddling gear needs; fits right, provides cover when needed and it looks good! Thanks!- the plantman
review.name: New Hoody

name: Solarflex Hoodie - Women's

review.reviewBody: The price point is excellent but the trail endurance compound is just too hard. As the trails get looser heading into SoCal summer this tire had the rear of my bike wagging as I should have ordered at least a soft compound enduro casing. This trail casing pedals uphill very well and might be ok on grippier dirt, bike paths/fireroads, or conservative riding styles but I lost all confidence when this tire couldn’t hold any of the loose conditions that my pretty standard Maxxis DHR II Exo+ 3C MaxTerra could. I’ve replaced this tire after 2 rides with a Conti Argotal Enduro Soft which may be an over correction, but I want to give Continental a shot.
review.name: Really wanted to like this tire

review.reviewBody: I replaced the Maxxis tires that originally came with my Ibis Ripley. The one problem is I bought to big. The Maxxis were 2.6 and these are too, but the Kryptotal will rub the frame as it is a touch bigger. I got creative and changed the air in rear shock and it has helped. The tires are amazing though otherwise. I ride in the Phoenix desert mountains and loose gravel, stones, lots of huge granite swaths are the norm, and these tires are a champ.
review.name: Control is much better

name: Kryptotal-R 29in Tire

review.reviewBody: This is the second solar shower that I have purchased (my wife and now have our own). One Nemo will work for 2 people but for a longer shower, we each get our own.  Nemo makes a great product.  No complaints.
review.name: Piggy delivers

review.reviewBody:
We've been using this helio shower nemo for 2 years now when we go away at the weekend with our van. We were delighted with the shower until we couldn't use it any more because of the foot pump. It's very difficult to pump and you can hear bubbles in the balloon and there's no presso for showering. Thank you for your reply as we would like to use it during our holidays in August!
Sincerely
K.  Mergen
review.name: Helio shower nemo

review.reviewBody: Top notche quality! Very impressed by their products!!
review.name: Excellent camp shower!

review.reviewBody: We received this shower as a gift and thought it would be the perfect addition to our Namibian camping equipment.  While the concept is good the quality is not.  The hang strap broke the first time we used it and the seam near the fill cap busted on the second use and the shower no longer holds pressure.  its basically just an expensive sack of water now.  We live overseas and this product will be impossible to return.
review.name: Broke on second use
comment: Thanks for leaving a review! I'm sorry to hear that your shower failed on the first use. We'll certainly make sure the design team is aware of this feedback for the when we update the design. I'm so happy to see a CS team member has been able to get you sorted with a warranty replacement. Thanks again for leaving a review!

review.reviewBody: Perfect. Ruptures in local big water pipes caused several days without running water for about half a million people in western Puerto Rico.  Helio pressure shower served my household very well.  Also, it was delivered to us in a very short time.
review.name: very good product

review.reviewBody: I bought this shower prior to my last camping trip. The vessel pressurised well however the diameter of the flow from the nozzle made the whole event comical. I'm a big guy and trying to have a Shower with a jet of water only 1.5cm wide is underwhelming. Can NEMO please look into   selling a wide spray Shower head so as I don't have to but a different unit
review.name: Good concept, terrible nozzle!
comment: Thanks for leaving a review! We're sorry to hear that you're not pleased with the shower sprayer nozzle. It sounds like your unit may not be functioning correctly though. We appreciate your feedback and would like to bring in your shower for a warranty inspection. Please be on the lookout for an email from our customer support team.

review.reviewBody: Wouldn't work when the bag was on the ground. Only worked when the bag was level with the nozzle i.e. at head height. Returned the very next day.
review.name: Doesn't Work as Advertised

review.reviewBody: I have used my shower nearly everyday for a year as I travel full time in a van and it has not let me down
review.name: Durable

review.reviewBody:
I enjoyed the nozzle I thought it sprayed
 well, however I didn't enjoy when it was time to fill it back up. It is very hard to get the water in it and putting on the lid. Perhaps you can come up with a different design like maybe on the top and do not put a flap on it. Thanks
review.name: Helio Pressure Shower.
comment: Hi there! Sorry to hear about the pain it was to fill the shower up! We've passed this along to our product team for consideration when the Helio is up for a redesign. We appreciate the feedback!

review.reviewBody: This has been a game changer for our outdoor activities. We love to take it to the beach. After almost a year of use, we ended up getting too much sand in the spray head causing it to stop working. I filled out a warranty claim on this site and the staff responded quickly and shipped me a replacement spray head out. I am back in business and couldn’t be happier with this company.
review.name: Amazing product

name: Helio Pressure Shower

hasVariant.description: Buy the Fjallraven Fjallglim Flannel Shirt - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: My new shirt rules! I'm slim, the shirt fits well and is not all over me.
review.name: Great shirt

review.reviewBody: Holy moly, these run soooo big. I'm six feet tall, 180 pounds, so -- following the sizing advice -- I bought two of these shirts in large. I was practically swimming in then. I returned them for mediums, which are STILL too big. I may return for a small. Perhaps these are cut really large on purpose --- is that the new style? Anyway, order at least one and maybe TWO sizes smaller than you think you need.
review.name: Way WAY too big

review.reviewBody: Definitely runs big. I normally wear large and I had to buy a small for this shirt. I want to love this shirt but unfortunately there is zero flexibility in the fabric. I cannot flex by shoulders forward while wearing because the back panel has no flexibility. Also because I had to go so small, the sleeves are now slightly short.
review.name: No flexibility and runs big.

review.reviewBody: Feels good, looks better! High quality made to last.
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: The Fjallglim shirt looks good and is made of quality materials. I am 6' with a very slim figure and usually wear size medium. Ordered size small and the fit is great!
review.name: Good looking shirt

review.reviewBody: Love this shirt.  Ordered two colors , the forest green and the navy/orange and both look great.  They are warmer than standard button ups , they wash well / wrinkle free.  Only had for a season but they seem to be holding up well and be crafted pretty sturdily.  I will probably order another color this fall as they have quickly become my favorite flannel/button up type shirt.  It does run slightly loose - Im 5'10 175lbs and the M fits perfectly relaxed - not tight at all (i usually like slimmer fit but this is classic) but not too baggy to where it looks big.  So far Fjallraven has not disappointed (2 shirts & 2 jackets) so I will likely buy more.
review.name: Great Shirt

review.reviewBody: I bought this shirt in 4 colours. Perfect for everyday track and hunt in mid season climates.

I have three of these now an use them spring, through summer, and fall. Size down from you usual Fjallraven shirt size (E.g., Singi) for a trim but comfortable fit. I am 5'8" and an athletic 165 lbs and a S fits me perfectly. Great for travel, as it dries fast after washing. Thick, but not too warm. Sleeves are snug rolled up, but still comfortable. Recommended.
review.name: Great Three-Season Shirt, With a Nice Design

review.reviewBody: Beautiful materials and craftsmanship, weird cut for my body type. Fjällraven clothes usually fit me quite well, but this flannel is a miss for me. Well-fitting in the shoulders and chest , huge baggy arms and lower torso. Arm length is good. It's a weird combination.   Wish it fit better for me.
review.name: Beautiful materials and craftsmanship, weird cut

review.reviewBody: I have every color, that should tell you all you need to know.  Great fit.  Not too warm.  Classy flannel that works in office setting with jeans.  When a new color comes out, I get it.
review.name: Great fitting, great quality

name: Fjallglim Flannel Shirt - Men's

review.reviewBody: The fit was perfect and comfortable to wear for such a tall boot. Have yet to take them out in the elements but seem to be of high quality and I have no reservations on their performance
review.name: Boot

review.reviewBody: Great Sturdy hiking boot feel. I miss the cuteness of the old style. These are much more burley and function well; but score low on style in my opinion. Also run slightly large. I have to wear thick socks and am thinking of getting insoles to take up a little space. Good for my wide feet. No pinching whatsoever.
review.name: Nice i Boot

review.reviewBody: I love these boots! No breaking in. Keen keeps my feet comfortable.
review.name: Comfort and warm

review.reviewBody:
They are arrived quickly, now I’m excited to share my experience after a month of wearing these incredible boots right out of the box! They fit perfectly, providing exceptional support for my high arch, slight supination, and spinal stenosis. Every step is invigorating, precisely what I need to conquer my daily adventures: constant support & shock absorption, no rubbing, no discomfort, no leaning, and no loose shoestrings. 

Living overseas during the wet season, I truly value how these boots keep my feet comfortable, warm, and dry. Although I haven't taken them on intense treks, their versatility shines in everyday use. Whether off-road walking, enjoying a casual day in denim, or tackling gardening and DIY outdoor projects, these boots have consistently proven reliable companions.

I love wearing them with or without socks, and they perform beautifully even on muddy, rainy, flooded days—I never feel constricted. These boots have significantly elevated my footwear game, and I’m eager to continue exploring with them!
review.name: All-day comfort & all-weather performance boots

review.reviewBody: Best fitting boots ever! I have had bunion correction on left foot, and need to have right foot done. No hurting or rubbing in these boots. The fit is great, they are warm and keep my feet perfectly dry. They work great with snowshoes and spikes. This is my second pair.
review.name: Best boots for bunions

review.reviewBody: After a few weeks, these boots are awesome. Comfortable (with my regular inserts) so I can spend hours trekking around with the weed eater or at the dog park. I predict they'll keep my feet warm on winter dog park outings, which is very important to me. I just sprayed them off with the hose and my feet didn't get a bit wet. Tall enough to cover the bottom of my pants so ticks don't get me. Thank you for making my dream boots!!
review.name: Best yardwork & dog park boots I've ever owned

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a comfortable mid-tall boot for light trail hiking through damp grassy areas. This boot fits great and is padded in all the right places to prevent any chaffing/blisters from the get go. Good tread and foot/ankle support. Ample toe box. I love the zipper for easy on/off. Seems well-made so I’m looking for years of use like I’ve come to expect from Keen. Thanks for developing another great boot!
review.name: Excellent Mid-Boot

review.reviewBody: I love these boots! Wore them in Sweden in February in the snow and on icy sidewalks. They were comfortable and warm. I'm a 9, but got a 9.5 mainly because the six previous boots that I'd tried from other companies all ran small. It was a perfect fit. Glad I finally found a good boot. Love the side zipper for easy in and out and the laces to tighten the boot up.
review.name: I love these boots!

review.reviewBody:
The package arrived on time and no damage.
And the boots fit perfectly, very comfy.
review.name: Great features!

review.reviewBody: I live in a rural area without good places to walk in the winter except gravel roads that get hard packed with snow and ice. These boots are AMAZING for traction on those conditions. No slipping or sliding and I can get a great walk in. They are comfortable and keep my feet nice and warm - even in below zero temperatures.
review.name: Perfect for snow and ice!

name: Greta Tall WP Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: I like this thing, it's tarp. It has a lot of attachment points and they are reinforced. It is way lighter than a normal-people tarp. It also packs down much smaller than its listed size if you put it in a compression pack. It does not get lighter, but smaller, which was important. I set it up w/ a MSR screen-mesh house(2) and they are cool together. Tarp FTW.
review.name: A tarp!

review.reviewBody: I'm takin it Saturday Spring Bear huntin here n Alaska to test it along with th rest o my new Eureka equipment!
review.name: Great Features, love it!

My only knock is that sometimes after making a call I have to reconnect the Bluetooth.  This is a solid product by POC!

review.reviewBody: Helmet had a charging cord but it would not fit in jack ( I tried for 10 min with no luck and then my daughters best efforts failed also)  Also ear pieces were very tight and would pop off when attempting to put on. nice concept :( FAIL

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Got this for my mama! She's obsessed with it! She's going to Iceland in a couple months and couldn't be more happy!! Super warm perfect length and fit! She's 5'4 and wears a large this fits perfect with s thin long sleeve under it!
review.name: Super Warm!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It was the perfect fit which meant that I was not able to put a sweater on under it. Recommend going a size up.
review.name: Size up but super cute.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Just what i expected, this item proved to be a great buy
review.name: Warm and light

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This coat is versatile for different weather and looks fantastic on. I was looking for something I could wear alone in a rainy, 50 degree spring that could transition into 30 degree winter wear and I love it! It’s roomy enough to comfortably wear an additional sweater layer beneath if needed while still maintaining an overall flattering silhouette due to the construction of  the underarm area and the multiple snaps at the waist. Check your chest measurement and order accordingly.
review.name: This is the only coat you need

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Happy with the purchase. Very cozy and great fit. Great price-value deal
review.name: Great quality

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this coat! It's super warm and comfy, and I look forward to giving it a thorough test in the winter!  I love that it was discounted greatly in the off season, and shipping was so quick!
review.name: This will make CA girls look forward to winter!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Awesome jacket! Vert cute and comfortable. I wish the coat was a little longer length wise and the pockets are not as convenient as I had hoped. But overall very happy with my purchase!
review.name: Very Comfortable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the color and style, the hips are a little tighter than I was expecting for the size but it has vent zippers which helps with the fit. Overall I would definitely size up if you are between sizes or want to be able to layer. Feels like it will be warm enough for the winter.
review.name: Warm, runs a little small/slim

review.reviewBody: Very nice and comfortable, reasonable price. Keep body hot.
review.name: Good purchase and fast delivery. I used in cold.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This coat is really good quality and really helps keep me warm. Over the zipper there is also Velcro attachments to really keep it insulated which helps a lot in the wind. The fit is slightly awkward when it’s completely zipped up because it stops around the middle of my chin, but otherwise the fit is great.
review.name: Good winter coat

review.reviewBody: This would have been my third R1 Air Fleece purchased.  I returned it because, unlike my first two, the Torrey Pine color fit much tighter in the shoulders. The sleeves were shorter and it measured smaller as well when I held it up to my others.  I’m so disappointed as the color, material, and functionality of this fleece has been outstanding in the two I already own.
review.name: Sizing varies by color.

review.reviewBody: I bought this R1 Air in size medium. Yes, it runs just slightly narrower than some other Patagonia tops, but I still comfortably have room for a thin long underwear top under it. I don’t feel it’s constricting, because of the way it is cut, there is room under the arm pits. The fabric is light and soft. I love how the zipper comes half way down the front instead of just a quarter way. Makes it easier to get on and off. I also love how the sleeves are the perfect length and this fleece top is long enough too. Both features are So Very important when moving, stretching, working outdoors. Thank you Patagonia for designing this top perfectly! I think it’s true to size for a slim fit top. If you like your tops roomy then go up a size.
review.name: Womens Patagonia R1 Air zip

review.reviewBody:
Definitely fits much slimmer than other Patagonia pieces I own. While it is meant to be snug, there is little stretch in the material so feels constricting. Fabric technology however is fantastic. Wicks sweat/heat off the body keeping you dry and your temp regulated. Now I just need to find the right size!

Female
5'7" 
145lb
Normally medium in all Patagonia, but need to size up.
review.name: Slim

name: R1 Air Zip-Neck Fleece - Women's

review.reviewBody: These are beautiful sandals but if you don't have fat feet you will be out of luck. It's not an issue of high or low arches or of foot length or even toe length. review.reviewBody: These gaiters are the best. They are very sturdy and fit perfectly over my hiking boots. I wear a size 8 boot and I got the small size. The small works perfect when I'm just wearing leggings/hiking pants/jeans. This is my second pair. I have a medium size as well that I like to wear when I'm wearing my snow pants. They are great for wearing in the snow or on dewy morning hikes and prevent my socks/lower pant legs from getting soaked. My mediums I've had for about 10 years and they are still going strong!
review.name: Love These Gaiters!

review.reviewBody: These are great and work very well in damp environments and deep snow. Great alternative to tall boots!
review.name: Great accessory!

review.reviewBody: I have to replace these every 2, sometimes less than 2, years due to what I call the Velcro toe guards. Yes they're guaranteed but dealing with some of their warranty staff is not worth the trouble. There are other outdoor stores that are just as good and are less of a hassle. I'm done with OR. I've asked to be removed from their database but they sent me this. Again.
review.name: Not good

review.reviewBody: Used on a few wintery hikes and they did a great job keeping me dry. One of the buckles broke and I got a replacement very quickly. Looks like the new version has better/stronger buckles. Very happy with the customer service.
review.name: Great customer service

review.reviewBody: Just bought a replacement for the same pair I've had for years which I lost. I wore them when I climbed Mt Kilimanjaro. I wear them when I snowshoe, climb, hike. They are very very sturdy and last forever. Super water proof and will resist even scuffs from crampons. Great product.
review.name: I would buy these over and over again

review.reviewBody: I've been using these gaiters to hike in the snow on warmer winter days. I get too hot wearing snow or shell pants but still don't want to get snow in my boots and these gaiters fixed that problem for me. They are waterproof and durable.
review.name: Great gaiters

review.reviewBody: I love the Velcro and the waterproof fabric. The boot lace hook and strap don't fit that well on my hiking boot so they tend to move as I walk on rock and snow
review.name: must have on harsh environments

review.reviewBody: Works as expected. Runs a little small on larger snow boots given the size chart.
review.name: Works.

review.reviewBody: Bought small women's. I wear a 7.5 to 8 shoe, 5.5, 135 lb, athletic calves. These fir very well for me. Used them cross country skiing, and they keep feet dry. I personally don't like Velcro since it will destroy certain other clothing items that might come into contact with it, but they do seal really well and stay sealed.
review.name: Good gaiters for skiing

review.reviewBody: I have had a pair of these for about 15 years. My partner needed a pair to replace the brand that failed for them. Every day ware at 9000' 6-8 months a year.
review.name: Amazingly durable

review.reviewBody: Warm and comfortable. Easy to pack. Travels well. Great color.
review.name: Versatile jacket

review.reviewBody: I have a Ghost Whisperer jacket but sometimes its just too warm. So I got the Ventano and it has been perfect. Good jacket for everything really. I've been wearing it daily since I got it.
review.name: Great lightweight but warm jacket!

review.reviewBody:
More than content with this jacket purchase! It's light, kept me warm, and can pack up really compact for ease of storage when you're not using it. 

I recently used this on a hike in the Canadian rockies in winter on a 5 hour hike with 744M elevation gain. When I reached  the summit, it was very exposed and the wind was blowing really strong around 65km/hr. 

The jacket kept me warm along with another mountain hardwear gore-tex jacket I had on top of it. 

I would highly recommend!
review.name: Light, warm, and compact

review.reviewBody: I bought it on close out after the season. Was unpleasantly surprised at how thin it is! I would have returned it but for the meaningfully discounted price. I wouldn’t buy it again.
review.name: Paper thin!

review.reviewBody:
Bought recently, happy with the product so far,
Will see how the zipper holds up,
Own two Ghost whisperer jackets- Zippers failed on both (men's and women's) within a first year..
The size guide is totally wrong! Sleeves are very short.. My height 188cm need a XL for adequate sleeves length.. website recommends M
Great fit and good warmth for hiking on cold mornings or casual wear around town. Haven't tested it skiing yet but seems like it will be good.
review.name: Ventano

review.reviewBody: Ive been skiing the XT and SL for three seasons now and it is hands down the best touring boot Ive always wanted. With a performance fit I can absolutely smash descents on 188 by 117 Faction skis yet it walks with more cuff articulation than I can even use. This is my go to boot for most days, even on long approaches into the wilderness for laps on big lines for 12k days. From deep into the Colorado backcountry to big exposed Teton lines, Chamonix and British Colombia the 4 Quatro is my dream boot.
review.name: Charges as hard tours easy

name: 4-Quattro XT Alpine Touring Boot

review.reviewBody: I replaced the VESL bottle cage with this model. The original bottle cage couldn’t hold a bottle in place in the smallest amount of chop, and the mounting bolts were too long, scratching the bottle. This cage is tight around the bottle and the surface is rubbery, effectively holding the bottle in place in heavy chop and waves. The cage can be mounted with accessibility to either side, so mount the cage with the accessibility “up”.
review.name: Replacement for Prone Paddleboard Bottle

review.reviewBody: Keeps your bottle tight on rough rides. Easy to get in and out of. Would recommend.
review.name: Nice cage

review.reviewBody:
I bought these for my daughter, who's been competing for her 3rd season now. She likes a slightly stiffer shoe and really likes these for bouldering and for lead.  She had a more aggressive pair of Ocun (Ozone), which worked very well but her young toes were taking a beating.  We tried Scarpa Quantic (men's version), which were great too. They were a bit too soft for her though.

The Ocun rubber is very sticky. Sizing is generally on the small side, tend to need to go up a size.  They are her current favorite for training and comps
review.name: Excellent all-around shoes

name: Havoc Climbing Shoe

review.reviewBody:
As per usual, this is another example of MRs outstanding quality and design. We were considering this pack and the Radix, and ultimately went with the Bridger for some of the extra pockets and features. This is my wife’s first pack and it was a good choice overall for getting started, but having plenty of growth for more technical applications later. 
The sizing is accurate and, once adjusted, the fit is excellent. The size is just about right for our typical day/overnight hiking and camping trips. It would probably suffice for a couple days if we went longer, but it is nice and light and supports weight well.
review.name: Always great packs

review.reviewBody: This pack is very adjustable and I am able to have a perfect fit. On other packs the straps would rub on my neck, I have very narrow shoulders. I love the dual straps in the front and the hip belt is very comfortable. Made my load feel very light. I am very happy to have found this pack.
review.name: Great fitting pack.

review.reviewBody: You guys make great and bombproof packs and I absolutely LOVE the idea behind this - I wear a running vest for a lot of shorter hikes and longer runs because of the vest-like fit and because I love having the big chest pockets and additional support in the front.  I bought this for fastpacking, for some summer objectives that are part ultra run part backpacking trips.  The thought behind this pack is great and the quality is top notch as always, but I feel like it falls short in that it feels like a men's pack that was marginally retrofit for women, not a pack designed from the ground up for women.  Examples - the shoulder straps are a little too wide-set, even for me (I'm 5'10" with a 36" bust and wear a size 10).  The wire frame is a little too "tall" in that it comes up pretty high and when I tilt me head back the back of my head hits it.  And the two straps in the front - though I love them because of the nice close fit they provide, they're located in such a place that the bottom strap cuts directly across the girls, which makes for an awkward "four boob" situation.  A little shaping there with slightly more "s" shaped shoulder straps and better placement of the bottom strap would be amazing.  Other non-gender-specific notes: I wish it had a stretch mesh back pocket for a wet jacket, and the wire frame at the top is super wide - like you have to really pull/stretch the "brain" part over it, and it's a little awkward.  It's a little overbuilt in some places that I don't feel are really necessary for a pack that's designed to be something more of a "fast and light" pack.  I would love love love to see a second iteration of this pack that's built specifically for women and I'd happily volunteer to test it out!
review.name: Love the Idea But Needs Work

name: Bridger 35L Backpack - Women's

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Every now and again I take a chance on the unknown, but rarely when it pertains to clothing.  This year I found myself in need of a new pair of paddling shorts when I happened on Marmot’s Juniper Springs shorts. 

Not one to risk a 10 hour day in the kayak to uncomfortable gear, I spent a few days wandering around the house.  Whether lounging on the couch or cleaning the kitchen, all was well.  No pinching, rough seams, or bunching, just what I was looking for.  Should you find yourself in need of comfortable shorts these will do the trick.
review.name: When You Don’t Need Pants…Try These Shorts

review.itemreviewed: Targhee Mid WP Shoe - Little Kids'
review.reviewBody: These size 10 toddler are going to be wonderful for the winter! They just have to be broken in a bit.. They are kind of stiff.
review.name: Toddler keens

review.itemreviewed: Targhee Mid WP Shoe - Little Kids'
review.reviewBody: Strap broke after being worn 2x. Stay away.
review.name: Crap quality

review.itemreviewed: Targhee Mid WP Shoe - Little Kids'
review.reviewBody: "Excellent quality with a good grip that keeps little feet secure, but they're a bit tricky to put on a toddler.
review.name: Super nice

review.itemreviewed: Targhee Mid WP Shoe - Little Kids'
review.reviewBody: These boots could be great but we reslly struggle to get my child's feet into these boots. Maybe my kid has stubby high volume feet because the seem to thick to get into these size 9's, even the 10's which are definitely a bit big are difficult to get on! The heel cup angles forward too aggressively. And the front tongue area doesn't expand enough to make up for it. Every time we try it feels like we're going to hurt him. Just not worth it and looking for an alternative.
review.name: Can't get them on my child's feet!

review.itemreviewed: Targhee Mid WP Shoe - Little Kids'
review.reviewBody: My toddler loves his boots. He happily hiked 7 miles so far in it with no complaints of discomfort or heaviness. He also ran on the trail a lot in them. I’d say they’re a great buy! The waterproof feature also helped while we walked through creeks and splashed in puddles. My kiddos are in between sizes, and I chose to get the half size bigger. Fit perfectly.
review.name: Great quality and comfort!

review.itemreviewed: Targhee Mid WP Shoe - Little Kids'
review.reviewBody: Our little Grandson probably should have had a wide size. They were not easy to get on him his feet are still chubby. But he liked them so much he had to wear them and then we couldn’t send them back. MY CHOICES BELOW ARE REGARDING MY GRANDSON ONLY. IT WAS A VERY NICE SHOE.
review.name: We liked

name: Targhee Mid WP Shoe - Little Kids'

review.reviewBody:
The Blackburn multi tool in this bag works.
I have had many kinds of multi tools over a lot of years.
This works because the handle allows to get in tight spots....with disc brakes and calipers it's more difficult to get to some of the parts.  Nicer bikes have bolt adjuster instead of screws (that was my issue).  To get to the adjuster traditional multi tools were too short and the handle too bulky to navigate.....so that is why this tool is the one to use.
review.name: simple bike tool
